class_description:
Note
As of iOS 10, macOS 10.12, tvOS 10, and watchOS 3, Foundation provides the MeasurementFormatter class, which can be used to represent quantities of UnitLength to provide equivalent functionality to LengthFormatter. You are encouraged to transition to these new Foundation Units and Measurements APIs whenever possible.

params.param_description: An output parameter. If overridden, this parameter should contain the object created from the provided string.
A string representation of the object.
An output parameter. If overridden, this parameter should contain a description of any errors that occur. If you do not want to receive error messages, set this parameter to NULL.

return_description: true if the conversion from string was successful; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_description: This method is not supported for the NSLengthFormatter class.
Methods.method_declar: func getObjectValue(_ obj: AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer<AnyObject?>?, for string: String, errorDescription error: AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer<NSString?>?) -> Bool

return_description: A string that combines a value and a unit string appropriate for the formatter’s locale.

Methods.method_description: Returns a length string for the provided value.

params.param_description: The length’s value in the given unit.
The unit used in the resulting length string.

return_description: A localized string that combines the provided value and unit.

Methods.method_description: Returns a properly formatted length string for the given value and unit.
Methods.method_declar: func string(fromValue value: Double, unit: LengthFormatter.Unit) -> String

params.param_description: An output parameter. This will hold the LengthFormatter.Unit value that corresponds to the returned units.

return_description: A localized string representing the unit.

Methods.method_description: Returns the unit string for the provided value.
Methods.method_declar: func unitString(fromMeters numberInMeters: Double, usedUnit unitp: UnsafeMutablePointer<LengthFormatter.Unit>?) -> String

params.param_description: The length’s value for the provided unit.
The unit to use in the resulting length string.

return_description: A localized string representing the given unit. The provided value determines whether the unit is plural or singular.

Methods.method_description: Returns the unit string based on the provided value and unit.
Methods.method_declar: func unitString(fromValue value: Double, unit: LengthFormatter.Unit) -> String

Vars.var_description: A Boolean value that indicates whether the resulting string represents a person’s height.
The number formatter used to format the numbers in length strings.
The unit style used by this formatter.
